oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: WSM Radio delayed broadcast of the Country Music Hall of Fame medallion ceremony - 2007-11-05. Tape two of three.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Delayed broadcast by WSM radio of the Country Music Hall of Fame medallion ceremony with tributes and performances from the 2007 Country Music Hall of Fame honoring Vince Gill and Mel Tillis from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on November 5, 2007. Delayed broadcast on WSM Radio.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kyle Young; Eddie Stubbs; Rodney Crowell; Emmylou Harris; Michael McDonald; Guy Clark; Al Anderson; Bobby Bare; Vince Gill;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress. (00:00) WSM radio commercial and news/weather break / ( 04:20) Introduction of Medallion all-star band / (06:09) Kyle Young introduces Vince Gill segment / (08:01) Introduction of Rodney Crowell and Emmylou Harris with performance of Some Things Never Get Old / (12:34) Kyle Young continues with the Vince Gill segment / (15:00) Introduction of Michael McDonald who performs Go Rest High On That Mountain / (21:21) Eddie Stubbs break in with WSM announcements / (28:19) Eddie Stubbs interviews Vince Gill during the pre-ceremony festivities and WSM break / (40:55) Kyle Young continues with the Vince Gill segment / (43:02) Introduction of Guy Clark who performs Randall Knife / (48:22) Kyle Young continues with the Vince Gill segment / (49:35) Introduction of Al Anderson who performs Next Big Thing / (54:34) Kyle Young continues with the Vince Gill segment and introductions of audience and family members /

(01:02:13) Eddie Stubbs with WSM break in for top of the hour news break / (01:10:10) Kyle Young continues with Vince Gill segment with introduction of Bill Anderson who makes comments and presents Hall of Fame medallion to Vince Gill / (01:17:48) Vince Gill acceptance speech / (01:31:14) Eddie Stubbs comments and long WSM break / (01:43:23) Kyle Young begins Mel Tillis segment / (01:49:30) Introduction of Bobby Bare who performs the song Detroit City / (01:55:39) Eddie Stubbs with WSM break in and Grand Ole Opry excerpt / END OF TAPE TWO.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Young, Kyle; Stubbs, Eddie; Crowell, Rodney; Harris, Emmylou; McDonald, Michael; Clark, Guy; Anderson, Al (Guitarist); Bare, Bobby; Gill, Vince; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
